gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development - Center for Public Health and Environmental Assessment (CPHEA), EnviroAtlas

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: EnviroAtlas - 2016 Riparian Land Cover Proportions by 12-Digit HUC for Alaska

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. EPA Office of Research and Development (ORD) - Center for Public Health and Environmental Assessment (CPHEA)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This EnviroAtlas dataset represents the percentage of land area that is classified as forest, forest including woody wetlands, and natural land cover that occurs within 45 meters of streams, rivers, and other hydrologically connected waterbodies within each 12-digit hydrologic unit code (HUC) in Alaska. Land cover is defined using the 2016 National Land Cover Dataset (NLCD). Streams were derived from the NHD (National Hydrography Dataset) High Resolution dataset obtained June 2020. This dataset was produced by the US EPA to support research and online mapping activities related to EnviroAtlas. EnviroAtlas (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas) allows the user to interact with a web-based, easy-to-use, mapping application to view and analyze multiple ecosystem services for the contiguous United States. The dataset is available as downloadable data (https://edg.epa.gov/data/Public/ORD/EnviroAtlas) or as an EnviroAtlas map service. Additional descriptive information about each attribute in this dataset can be found in its associated EnviroAtlas Fact Sheet (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets).

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: This dataset is useful for evaluating the potential value of ecosystem services provided by vegetation communities, and the impacts of developed land cover. The overall goal of EnviroAtlas is to employ and develop the best available science to map indicators of ecosystem services production, demand, and drivers for the nation.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development - Center for Public Health and Environmental Assessment (CPHEA), EnviroAtlas

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Use Constraints: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currency and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: Entity and Attribute Overview: These metrics were generated using the ATtILA tool (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/attila-toolbox), an ArcGIS tool for calculating commonly used landscape metrics. The land cover input is the 2016 NLCD (www.mrlc.gov/). The stream inputs were derived from the NHDFlowline, NHDWaterbody, and NHDArea feature classes in the NHD High Resolution datasets ( https://www.usgs.gov/core-science-systems/ngp/national-hydrography/access-national-hydrography-products). For more information on the metric calculation, please see the ATtILA User's Manual included with the toolbox. A comprehensive list of metric creation steps is included in the Processing Steps. Entity and Attribute Detail Citation: https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development - Center for Public Health and Environmental Assessment (CPHEA), EnviroAtlas

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Data were collected using methods that have unknown accuracy (EPA National Geospatial Data Policy [NGDP] Accuracy Tier 10). For more information, please see EPA's NGDP at https://epa.gov/geospatial/policies.html
Features represented have not been tested for completeness
Features represented have not been tested for completeness

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Tests for integrity have not been performed.

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: This lineage was generated by the FGDC CSDGM to 19139 transformation

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Obtained the NLCD 2016 land cover raster for Alaska (NLCD_2016_Land_Cover_AK_20200213.img)
Performed a setnull operation on the NLCD_2016_Land_Cover_AK_20200213.img to eliminate the edge areas (Value = 0). Output raster: NLCD2016AK_ND.
Obtained the NHDPlusV2 Watershed Boundary Dataset (WBD) Snapshot for Alaska, EnviroAtlas version (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas).

Downloaded the National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) High Resolution datasets by HU-4 Subregions from https://www.usgs.gov/core-science-systems/ngp/national-hydrography/access-national-hydrography-products.

Processed each NHDFlowline feature class in the NHD with the StrmLine HiRes Iterative Tool in the AtlasAnalyses Toolbox (a self-created toolbox for the purpose of standardizing analyses for the EnviroAtlas). The StrmLine HiRes Iterative tool performs the following operations:
Step 1 - Iterates through the NHD Workspace and processes each NHD High Resolution geodatabase found there.
Step 2 - From the current geodatabase, the NHDFlowline feature class is found in the Hydrography feature dataset.
Step 3 - Flowlines with "FTYPE" = 460 OR "FTYPE" = 334 OR "FTYPE" = 558 are then selected

Step 4 - Those selected flowlines are then copied into a new feature class named, strmLineXXXX, where XXXX is the 4-digit HU code. Only the Permanent_Identified, Reachcode, Ftype, and Shape_Length fields are retained.
Step 5 - Identifying the end points of the flowline then begins by converting all vertices from the selected flowlines to points.
Step 6 - The ArcGIS Near (Analysis) tool is then employed using the vertices point layer as both the input features and the near features.

Step 7 - The StrmLine HiRes Iterative Tool concludes by copying points with a near distance greater than 0 into a new feature class named, strmEndXXXX, where XXXX is the 4-digit HU code. Only the Near_Dist field is retained from the Near operation.

Processed each NHDArea and NHDWaterbody feature class in the NHD with the StrmAreal HiRes Iterative Tool in the AtlasAnalyses Toolbox (a self-created toolbox for the purpose of standardizing analyses for the EnviroAtlas). The StrmAreal HiRes Iterative tool performs the following operations:
Step 1 - Iterates through the NHD Workspace and processes each NHD High Resolution geodatabase found there.
Step 2 - From the current geodatabase, the NHDArea feature class is found in the Hydrography feature dataset.
Step 3 - NHDAreas with "FTYPE" = WASH are selected.
Step 4 - Select by Location is used to reduce the selected washes to only those that are within 1 Meters of features in the corresponding strmLineXXXX, where XXXX is the current 4-digit HU code.
Step 5 - NHDArea features with FTYPE = StreamRiver or Rapids or Lock Chamber are added to the selected Washes.
Step 6 - From the corresponding NHDWaterbody feature class, NHDWaterbodies with "FTYPE" = Reservoir or LakePond or Ice Mass are selected.

Step 7 - Select by Location is used to reduce the selected NHDWaterbodies to only those that are within 1 Meters of features in the corresponding strmLineXXXX, where XXXX is the current 4-digit HU code.
Step 8 - The selected NHDWaterbodies and selected NHDAreas are merged into a new feature class named, NHD_MergeXXXX, where XXXX is the current 4-digit HU code.
Step 9 - An integer type field named, "dummy", is added to NHD_MergeXXXX, and its value is calculated as 1.
Step 10 - NHD_MergeXXXX is then dissolved based on the "dummy" field. Multipart features are not created. Only boundaries between polygons immediately adjacent to each other are dissolved.

Step 11 - A second dissolve is performed on NHD_MergeXXXX, again using the "dummy" field and not opting for multipart output features. The second dissolve helps to reduce splits in polygons sometimes introduced when the GIS software resorts to tiling to process large datasets.
Step 12 - Select by Location is used to select areal water features in NHD_MergeXXXX that are within 1 Meters of features in the corresponding strmENDXXXX feature class.
Step 13 - Select by Location is used to add to the selected features in NHD_MergeXXXX any areal water feature that intersects the line features in the corresponding strmLineXXXX feature class.
Step 14 - The StrmAreal HiRes Iterative Tool ends by copying the selected features in NHD_MergeXXXX into a new feature class named, strmArealXXXX, where XXXX is the current 4-digit HU code.

For each strmLine#### feature class, all features where Ftype did not equal 558 (Artificial Paths) were selected and saved as strmLine####_NAP. NAP stands for No Artificial Paths and #### is the 4-digit HUC code from the NHD.

Buffer zones within 45 meters of streams, rivers, and other hydrologically connected waterbodies were generated using the Riparian Land Cover Proportions tool in the Riparian Characteristics toolset of the ATtILA for ArcGIS toolbox (ATtILA 10_0.tbx, 5/26/2016 version) in ArcGIS by selecting INTERMEDIATES from the Additional Options parameter. Used NHDPlusV2_WBDSnapshot_EnviroAtlas_AK as the reporting unit feature, NLCD2016AK_ND as the land cover grid, and the respective strmLine####_NAP and strmAreal#### shapefiles for each NHD 4-digit HUC region as the stream features. A user-defined land cover scheme for the NLCD2016AK_ND (NLCD 2001-2016 ICELAND) dataset was used to identify land cover classes. Output buffer feature classes were saved in the NAPBuffers_HU19 geodatabase. The ATtILA tool was used because it restricts buffer zones from crossing HUC boundaries.

Ran into an issue with strmLine1903 as this dataset encompasses the Aleutian Islands and crosses the international date line. StrmLine1903 was reprojected into the same projection as the NLCD_2016_Land_Cover_AK_20200213 raster before reprocessing the buffer zones using the Riparian Land Cover Proportions tool. Due to the size of the stream line feature dataset, the file was subsetted into smaller sections to allow for processing.
Merged the buffer themes in NAPBuffers_HU19.gdb. The output was saved in a geodatabase named, NAPBuffersAK.gdb. The output was named, Buffers45_HU19.
The Delete Identical (Data Management) tool was used on the Buffers45_HU19 feature class.
Added a text field named, HUC_8, to the attribute table for Buffers45_HU19, and calculated its values as !HUC_12![:8]
Performed a Frequency analysis on the HUC_8 field in the Buffers45_HU19 feature class. The frequency table was named, HUC19_HUC_8_List.

Ran the NHD HUC 2 WBD HUC tool from the AtlasAnalyses toolbox. This tool steps through the list of 8-digit HUC codes in the HUC19_HUC_8_List table and selects by attribute all of the buffer polygons in Buffers45_HU19 with matching values in the HUC_8 field. The selected buffer polygons are copied into a new feature class named, Buffer45_########, where ######## is the 8-digit HUC code. A separate feature class is created for each 8-digit HUC code record in the HUC19_HUC_8_List.
Performed Repair Geometry on all generated Buffer45_######## feature classes, where ######## is the 8-digit HUC code.

Performed a dissolve operation on each Buffer45_######## feature class using HUC_12 as the Dissolve Field. Create multipart features was selected. The output feature class was named, Buffer45_########_D.
Performed Repair Geometry on all Buffer45_########_D feature classes, where ######## is the 8-digit HUC code.
Merged the dissolved and repaired 8-digit HUC buffer feature classes into Buffers_HU19_WBD.

Land cover in the buffer zones was calculated using the Land Cover Proportions tool in the Landscape Characteristics toolset of the ATtILA for ArcGIS toolbox (ATtILA 10_0.tbx, 5/26/2016 version) in ArcGIS. Calculated NINDEX, pFor, and pFor90. Used NHDPlusV2_WBDSnapshot_EnviroAtlas_AK as the reporting unit feature and NLCD2016AK_ND as the land cover grid. Used a user-defined land cover scheme (NLCD 2011 ICELAND) for the NLCD dataset. The ICELAND designation in the land cover scheme indicates that areas of perennial ice is considered as available LAND in the percentage calculations and as a natural land cover class. The output table was named, RLCP2016_AK_ICE.

Joined the output table, RLCP2016_AK_ICE, to WBDSnapshot_EnviroAtlas_AK using the common HUC_12 field. Turned off all fields save HUC_12, NINDEX, pfor, and pfor90, and exported the joined table to make the join permanent. The output was saved in the Results.gdb and named, RLCP2016ICE_AK.
Used Alter Field to change the following field names in RLCP2016ICE_AK: NINDEX to rNI45, pFor to rFOR45, and pFor90 to rFOR90.
Deleted RLCP2016_AK and renamed RLCP2016ICE_AK to RLCP2016_AK

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: This metadata was automatically generated from the FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata standard (version FGDC-STD-001-1998) using the 2019-08-12T11:11:00 version of the FGDC CSDGM to ISO 19139 transform.
